result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn W Forgue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Shawn W Forgue was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn W Forgue is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Shawn W Forgue was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Shawn W Forgue was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. To be collected by the Department of Corrections. Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$343 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TS or EE. Def not to use/possess any alcohol without prior written approval of agent.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose. No objection to early termination after 18 months if def has completed all conditions of probation with no violations, ATR's or new charges to level of probable cause.
$167 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 5.
